ch.epfl.alpano

Class PanoramaParameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.epfl.alpano.PanoramaParameters

  • public final class PanoramaParameters
extends java.lang.Object
    This class stores the information about the panorama that we want to generate. It stores the observers elevation, max viewing distance, width, height, the center azimuth (center direction the panorama), horizontal field of view, DELTA.
    Author:
    Martin Cibils (261746), Jeremy Mion (261178)

    • Constructor Detail

      • PanoramaParameters

        public PanoramaParameters(GeoPoint observerPosition,
                          int observerElevation,
                          double centerAzimuth,
                          double horizontalFieldOfView,
                          int maxDistance,
                          int width,
                          int height)
        Build an instance of PanoramaParameter.
        Parameters:
        observerPosition - location from where we want the panorama to be generated.
        observerElevation - altitude of the the observer.
        centerAzimuth - direction in which the center of the panorama looks in.
        horizontalFieldOfView - The angle than we want to be able to observe. (ex.
        maxDistance - the maximum distance that the panorama needs to be generated
        width - in pixels of the picture to generate.
        height - in pixels of the picture to generate.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if observationPosition is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If centerAzimuth is not canonical.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If horizontalFieldOfView is not contained in ]0,2pi].
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If length, width, or distance are not strictly positive

    • Method Detail

      • observerPosition

        public GeoPoint observerPosition()
        Retrieves the position of the observer. As a GeoPoint.
        Returns:
        Position of the observer.
        See Also:
        GeoPoint

      • observerElevation

        public int observerElevation()
        Retrieves the elevation of the observer. In meters.
        Returns:
        Elevation of the observer.

      • maxDistance

        public int maxDistance()
        Retrieves the maximum viewing distance of the panorama. Further than this distance we cannot see. In meters.
        Returns:
        max viewing distance.

      • width

        public int width()
        Retrieves the width of the panorama. In pixels.
        Returns:
        width of the panorama to generate.

      • height

        public int height()
        Retrieves the height of the panorama. In pixels
        Returns:
        height of the panorana to generate.

      • centerAzimuth

        public double centerAzimuth()
        Retrieves the azimuth of the center of the panorama. Angle in radiant
        Returns:
        Azimuth of the center of the panorama. This is the main direction that the observer is looking in

      • horizontalFieldOfView

        public double horizontalFieldOfView()
        Retrieves the horizontal filed of view of the panorama. Angle in radiant.
        Returns:
        horizontal angle that the panorama covers.

      • verticalFieldOfView

        public double verticalFieldOfView()
        Retrieves the vertical filed of view of the panorama. Angle in radiant
        Returns:
        vertical angle that the panorama covers

      • azimuthForX

        public double azimuthForX(double x)
        Calculates the canonical azimuth corresponding to the index of the pixel (horizontal).
        Parameters:
        x - the pixel that will be used to calculate the azimuth of.
        Returns:
        azimuth of the pixel x. azimuth in canonicalized.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If x is not contained within [0, width-1]

      • xForAzimuth

        public double xForAzimuth(double a)
        Calculates the index of the pixel given an azimuth angle (horizontal).
        Parameters:
        a - azimuth angle.
        Returns:
        index of the pixel at the given angle. (horizontal)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the angle "a" is not within the filed of view of the panorama.

      • altitudeForY

        public double altitudeForY(double y)
        Retrieves the altitude corresponding to the index of a pixel in the vertical axis y.
        Parameters:
        y - Index of the pixel in the y-axis.
        Returns:
        Altitude of the pixel. Angle in radiant. Can be negative.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If "y" is not contained in [0, height-1]

      • yForAltitude

        public double yForAltitude(double a)
        Retrieves the vertical index of the pixel.
        Parameters:
        a - elevation.
        Returns:
        index of the vertical pixel corresponding to the angle a.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the angle does not belong to the visible area.
